Introduction


Welcome to the RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. universe, where imagination and creativity rule!


RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. Corporation and designated subsidiaries (â€œRobloxâ€, â€œwe,â€ or â€œusâ€) offers the RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. website (www.roblox.com) and its related platform (collectively, â€œPlatformâ€) and various other features and services, including websites, applications, forums, content, functionality, products, and services (together with the Platform, â€œServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services.â€) to allow users (â€œUsers,â€ â€œyour,â€ or â€œyouâ€) to play, create, and connect.


By accepting these User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The DevEx Terms apply to any CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Exchange Program (â€œDevEx ProgramStands for â€œDeveloper Exchange Program.â€ An exclusive, by-application-only, program through which Roblox allows approved Creators to exchange Earned Robux for real currency. USER TERMS


These User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms., along with the additional Creator TermsTerms of Use applicable to all Users who access the Services. They cover items such as the use of Roblox Studio, the offering of Experiences and Virtual Content, and the use of music on the Services., govern, among other things, what is called User Generated Content or â€œUGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services..â€ UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services. is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users create, upload, submit, publish, display, generate, transmit, or otherwise make available on the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services.. ALL USERS ARE SUBJECT NOT ONLY TO THESE USER TERMSTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms. BUT ALSO TO THE ADDITIONAL CREATOR TERMSTerms of Use applicable to all Users who access the Services. They cover items such as the use of Roblox Studio, the offering of Experiences and Virtual Content, and the use of music on the Services., WHICH ARE INCORPORATED HEREIN BY REFERENCE.

When you purchase a subscription to Roblox PremiumA renewing subscription that provides Users with certain additional benefits on the Services., you agree that your subscription service will automatically renew and that RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V., through its payment provider, is authorized to charge your payment method accordingly until you cancel the subscription. You may cancel Roblox PremiumA renewing subscription that provides Users with certain additional benefits on the Services. at any time by following the instructions available here. If you cancel Roblox PremiumA renewing subscription that provides Users with certain additional benefits on the Services., you can still enjoy the benefits for the period of time for which you have already paid. Roblox PremiumA renewing subscription that provides Users with certain additional benefits on the Services. subscriptions are non-refundable and non-transferable.

      1. 
Device, Age, and Region Restrictions. To access a Commerce Provider Activation, you must be at least 13 years of age and live in the United States, and certain features of the Commerce Provider Activation may only be available to eligible users based on device type.

Purchases from Commerce Providers.
          

        1. If you choose to make a purchase in a Commerce Provider Activation (including by clicking on a â€œBuyâ€ or â€œShopâ€ button, advertisement, â€œLearn more,â€ or other links or purchase methods), you will be using and interacting with an application or website operated by a third-party retailer, e-commerce platform, marketplace, brand, developer, and/or its and their designees (collectively, the â€œCommerce Provider,â€ and the application or website, the â€œCommerce Provider Websiteâ€) to complete your purchase. Roblox neither controls nor takes responsibility for any Third-Party Services. available to you.

You agree that you are solely responsible for your, or your Minorâ€™s (if applicable), conduct while using or accessing the Commerce Provider Website, and you must comply with the Commerce Provider Terms if you access or use the Commerce Provider Website. If there is any inconsistency or conflict between these Commerce Terms and the Commerce Provider Terms, the Commerce Provider Terms shall prevail solely with respect to any activity or transactions you make on the Commerce Provider Website.

Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency., Roblox PremiumA renewing subscription that provides Users with certain additional benefits on the Services. UGC Subscriptions may only be purchased using real currency (real world money). from RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. Corporation at Roblox.com, the price payable is the price indicated at the time of purchase, plus all applicable sales and/or use taxes, value added tax (â€œVATâ€) or goods and services tax (â€œGSTâ€) that RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. assesses on your purchase (the "Purchase Price").       4. 

    4. 
Copyright Infringement / Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA).
        

      1. 

        Notice. We respect the intellectual property rights of others, and we ask you to do the same. If you are a copyright owner or an agent of a copyright owner and believe that any content on the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. infringes upon your copyrights, you may submit a notice pursuant to the DMCA by contacting our Copyright Agent by email at copyright_agent@roblox.com or mail at Legal, 3150 S. Delaware St., San Mateo, CA 94403. You may also contact us by phone at (888) 858-2569. If a copyright owner is under the age of 13, a DMCA notice must be submitted by a parent, Guardian, or other adult representative. Your notice must include the following information:
        

          

        • An electronic or physical signature of the person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the copyright or other right being infringed;
          • 

        • A description of the copyright-protected work or other intellectual property right that you claim has been infringed;
          • 

        • A description of the material that you claim is infringing and where it is located;
          • 

        • Your address, telephone number, and email address;
          • 

        • A statement by you that you have a good faith belief that the use of those materials is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; and
          • 

        • A statement by you that the above information in your notice is accurate and that, under penalty of perjury, you are the copyright or intellectual property owner or authorized to act on the copyright or intellectual property ownerâ€™s behalf.
          • 

        

        You acknowledge that if you fail to comply with all of the requirements of this Section, your DMCA notice may not be valid. See 17 U.S.C. Â§ 512(c)(3) for further details. We may send a copy of your DMCA notice, including any contact information you provide, to the individual responsible for the reported content.
        

        2. 

      2. 
Counter-Notice. If your content was removed or disabled as a result of a DMCA notice, and you believe that your content is not infringing or that you have the proper authorization from the copyright owner, the copyright ownerâ€™s agent, or pursuant to the law to PublishThe means by which a User or Creator creates, uploads, submits, publishes, displays, generates, transmits, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. and use the material in your content, you may send a counter-notice to our Copyright Agent by email at copyright_agent@roblox.com or mail at Legal, 3150 S. Delaware St., San Mateo, CA 94403. Any counter-notice submitted on behalf of a UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. under the age of 13 must be submitted by a parent, Guardian, or other adult representative. When our Copyright Agent receives a counter-notice, we may send a copy of the counter-notice, including any contact information you provide, to the original complaining party informing that party that we may, in 10 business days, replace the removed content or stop disabling it. Unless the copyright owner files an action seeking a court order against the provider of the content, the removed content may be replaced or access to it restored, in our sole discretion, within 10 to 14 business days or more after our receipt of the counter-notice.
        3. 

      

      5. 

    5. 

      Trademark Infringement. If you are a trademark owner, or an agent of a trademark owner, and believe that any content on the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. infringes upon your registered trademark(s), please submit a trademark infringement notice to our Trademark Agent at trademark_agent@roblox.com or Legal, 3150 S. Delaware St., San Mateo, CA 94403. When you contact us, please provide the following information in your notice:
      

        

      • An electronic or physical signature of the person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the trademark;
        • 

      • A description of the trademark right that you claim has been infringed, including the country in which the trademark is registered and the registration number, if applicable;
        • 

      • A description of the content that you claim is infringing and where it is located;
        • 

      • Your address, telephone number, and email address;
        • 

      • A statement by you that you have a good faith belief that the use of such content is not authorized by the trademark owner, its agent, or the law; and
        • 

      • A statement by you that the above information in your notice is accurate and that, under penalty of perjury, you are the trademark owner or authorized to act on the trademark ownerâ€™s behalf.
        • 

      

      Note that RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. is not in a position to mediate disputes between Users and the holders of trademark rights. However, we take intellectual property rights seriously, and, upon receipt of a valid trademark infringement notice, we will investigate and may remove content that engages in trademark infringement. Note that for the purpose of a trademark infringement report you must be the owner of a registered trademark or their agent, pending trademark applications are not sufficient.
      

      6. 

    6. 
Repeat Infringer Policy. Robloxâ€™s intellectual property policy is to: (i) remove or disable access to content that RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. knows to be infringing on the intellectual property rights of third parties or that has been identified in a valid DMCA notice submitted by a valid copyright owner or their agent; and, (ii) in appropriate circumstances, to suspend or terminate the Accounts of and block access to the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. by any UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. who repeatedly or egregiously infringes the copyrights or other intellectual property rights of third-parties.

  7. Online Safety
    

    RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. cares about the safety of its Users. If you see any content or materials on the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. that appears to recruit, entice, advertise, or solicit any person to perform a sexual, violent, or illegal act, please contact Roblox Support and select the â€œUser Safety Concernâ€ help category to immediately report the UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. and situation.
    

      

    1.

User is granted a limited license to use the Services only on a â€œSystemâ€ (which includes PlayStation, PlayStation 2, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation Portable (PSP), PlayStation Vita (PS Vita), and PlayStation Vita TV (PS Vita TV), including all iterations and server emulations of each) that User owns or controls or such other system to which the Services are delivered by the proprietary online network operated by SCE or its affiliates, accessible via the Systems and other devices. Each SCE Company is a third party beneficiary of the Roblox Terms.

      4. 

    10. 

  10.  Experience Rules + Dispute Resolution (Between Users and Creators or Between Creators).
    

    If a UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. has an issue with any CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services. (including Experiences or other Virtual ContentAll UGC and Roblox created content â€“ including all Virtual Items and In-Experience Items â€“ available for acquisition by Users on the Services.     1. 

      ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. Rule Violations.       Experiences will have their own system for (i) monitoring UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. compliance with and (ii) moderating Users who violate the ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users.     1. 
Mandatory Informal DisputeAny dispute, claim, or controversy arising under or relating in any way to the Roblox Terms, whether based in contract, tort, or any other legal or equitable basis. Resolution. We hope thereâ€™s never a DisputeAny dispute, claim, or controversy arising under or relating in any way to the Roblox Terms, whether based in contract, tort, or any other legal or equitable basis. between us. But if there is, we both recognize and agree that good faith, informal efforts to resolve Disputes often result in prompt, low-cost, and mutually beneficial outcomes. Therefore, we each agree thatâ€”before either of us may commence an arbitration or assert any claim in court, except as set forth in Section 11.a.vi, belowâ€”we will engage in the following MIDRStands for â€œMandatory Informal Dispute Resolutionâ€.       1. Notice. To initiate the MIDRStands for â€œMandatory Informal Dispute Resolutionâ€. Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms..       1.

THAT CANNOT BE RESOLVED THROUGH MIDRStands for â€œMandatory Informal Dispute Resolutionâ€. USERAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. AND ROBLOXThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. THEREBY AGREE TO WAIVE ANY RIGHT TO A JURY TRIAL AND AGREE THAT USER AND ROBLOX MAY BRING CLAIMS AGAINST EACH OTHER ONLY IN AN INDIVIDUAL CAPACITY AND NOT AS A PLAINTIFF OR CLASS MEMBER IN ANY PURPORTED CLASS ACTION OR CLASS ARBITRATION.
        

        This arbitration agreement and class action waiver (â€œArbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms.â€) applies to all Users who are United States residents and, except as provided below, to all Disputesâ€”regardless of (a) the legal theories involved in the DisputeAny dispute, claim, or controversy arising under or relating in any way to the Roblox Terms, whether based in contract, tort, or any other legal or equitable basis., (b) when the DisputeAny dispute, claim, or controversy arising under or relating in any way to the Roblox Terms, whether based in contract, tort, or any other legal or equitable basis. arose, and (c) whether the DisputeAny dispute, claim, or controversy arising under or relating in any way to the Roblox Terms, whether based in contract, tort, or any other legal or equitable basis. is with RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V., with Robloxâ€™s subsidiaries, affiliates, or parent company, or with any suppliers or service providers involved with the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. (including any officers, directors, employees, agents, or successors).
        

        2. 

      2. Federal Arbitration Act; Interpretation; and Enforcement. This Arbitration Agreement is governed by the Federal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. Â§ 1 et seq.) (â€œFAAFederal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. Â§ 1 et seq.) that governs the terms of the Arbitration Agreement.â€), including its procedural provisions, in all respects. This means that the FAAFederal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. Â§ 1 et seq.) that governs the terms of the Arbitration Agreement. governs, among other things, the interpretation and enforcement of this Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. and all of its provisions, including, without limitation, the class action waiver. State arbitration laws do not govern in any respect. Further, UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. and RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. each agree that the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services.         3. 

      3. Arbitration Generally; Relief Available. There is no judge or jury in arbitration, and court review of an arbitration award is limited pursuant to the FAAFederal Arbitration Act (9 U.S.C. Â§ 1 et seq.) that governs the terms of the Arbitration Agreement.. However, an arbitrator can award, on an individual basis, the same damages and relief as a court (including injunctive and declaratory relief and statutory damages) and must follow the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms. as a court would. For the avoidance of doubt, the arbitrator can award public injunctive relief if authorized by law and warranted by the individual claim(s).
        4. 

      4. 

        Arbitration Proceedings and Rules. Arbitrations will be administered by FedArbA nationwide alternative dispute resolution firm that administers all arbitration proceedings under Robloxâ€™s MIDR process, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. in accordance with FedArbâ€™s Expedited Arbitration Rules and (if applicable) Framework for Mass Arbitration Proceedings ADR-MDL, except as modified by the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms.. In particular, the Framework for Mass Arbitration Proceedings ADR-MDL shall apply if five or more demands for arbitration are filed that share common factual or legal issues, and if counsel for the parties submitting those demands are the same or coordinated. Users can find more information at https://www.fedarb.com/ or by calling 1-650-328-9500.
        

        Unless required by law, or unless the parties mutually agree otherwise in writing, any arbitration hearingâ€”including oral argumentsâ€”will be conducted through video conferencing. If the arbitration hearing is conducted in person, it will take place in San Mateo County, California, if that is a convenient location for the UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services., or the county or parish where the UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. resides.
        

        At the conclusion of the arbitration, the arbitrator will issue a written decision explaining the findings and conclusions upon which the arbitratorâ€™s decision is based.
        

        Unless applicable law provides otherwise, the arbitration proceeding and all records pertaining to itâ€”including but not limited to any documents prepared or produced in connection with the arbitration proceeding, as well as the hearing, the decision, and the arbitration awardâ€”will be confidential and will not be disclosed to any third party, except as necessary to obtain court confirmation of the arbitration award.
        

        5. 

      5. Commencing an Arbitration. A party who has complied with the MIDRStands for â€œMandatory Informal Dispute Resolutionâ€. The process by which all User Disputes with Roblox will be governed and resolved, as set forth in Section 11 of the User Terms. process described above and who wishes to start arbitration must submit a demand for arbitration and a copy of the User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms. to FedArbA nationwide alternative dispute resolution firm that administers all arbitration proceedings under Robloxâ€™s MIDR process, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. at https://fedarb.my.salesforce-sites.com/Roblox_DemandForm.

        Users are otherwise responsible for their own costs and attorneysâ€™ fees; RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. will not pay such costs or attorneysâ€™ fees unless ordered to do so by the arbitrator.
        

        If the arbitrator finds that either the substance of the claim or the relief sought is frivolous or brought for an improper purpose, the parties agree that the arbitrator may order the losing party to reimburse the prevailing party for all arbitration feesâ€”as well as reasonable attorneysâ€™ fees and costs. Further, in cases where a statute authorizes the award of attorneysâ€™ fees or costs to the prevailing party, the arbitrator may award attorneysâ€™ fees or costs pursuant to that statute.
        

        The parties agree that FedArbA nationwide alternative dispute resolution firm that administers all arbitration proceedings under Robloxâ€™s MIDR process, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. has discretion to modify the amount or timing of any fees due under any applicable rules or fee schedules, and further agree not to oppose any modifications to the timing or amount of any fees dueâ€”provided that such modifications do not increase the fees to either party.

      8. Severability. If any provision of this Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. is found unenforceable, that provision will be severed, and the balance of the Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. will remain in full force and effect. If a court decides that applicable law precludes enforcement of this Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. as to any particular claim, then that claim must be severed from the arbitration, while the remaining claims will still be resolved through binding arbitration.

      10. Exceptions. The Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. shall be subject to the following exceptions:

          • 

        • The Arbitration AgreementA mandatory provision within the User Terms, applicable only to Users of the Services who reside in the U.S., that requires Disputes not resolved through MIDR to be resolved through binding, individual arbitration and waives the right to a jury trial and any class action or class arbitration, as set forth in Section 11(b) of the User Terms. does not apply to Users who are not residents of the United States, or to Users who (pursuant to subsection ix above) properly opt-out of the entire Arbitration Agreement within 30 days of signing up for the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users.           • 

        • If a DisputeAny dispute, claim, or controversy arising under or relating in any way to the Roblox Terms, whether based in contract, tort, or any other legal or equitable basis. is within the jurisdiction of small claims court, either the UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. or RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. may (after engaging in the MIDRStands for â€œMandatory Informal Dispute Resolutionâ€.       8. Intellectual Property Tools. RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. offers a suite of intellectual property tools that allow rights holders to detect and manage their intellectual property on the RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. platform. If a rights holder believes that their intellectual property is being used in your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users., they can choose to either claim the content in your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. or request your Experienceâ€™s removal.  When a rights holder claims content in your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users., the rights holder is allowing your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. to remain on the Platform in exchange for certain benefits.  First, the rights holder will receive a share of any RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. earnings attributable to your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. This includes the share of RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. earned through Virtual ContentAll UGC and Roblox created content â€“ including all Virtual Items and In-Experience Items â€“ available for acquisition by Users on the Services. Virtual Content has no real world equivalent value and Users do not acquire any enforceable legal rights in and to any Virtual Content based on any transaction on the Services., ads, and Engagement-Based Payouts. Second, the rights holder may monitor your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users., in which case the rights holder may receive aggregated engagement data about your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users.  Third, the rights holder may require you to take reasonable steps to comply with additional content standards.  If a rights holder claims content in your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users., you will have a limited time period to dispute or appeal the claim if you believe your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. was identified in error or if you have removed the claimed content.  Additional information and instructions on how to dispute or appeal will be provided to you if a rights holder claims content in your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users.. During the period when a rights holder claims content in your ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users., including during any dispute or appeal process, you agree not to take legal action against the rights holder for any claims arising from the presence of their intellectual property in your Experience.Interactive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users.

  3. Groups/Communities.
      

    1. 
Definitions.
        

      1. 
Groups.. A â€œGroupFor purposes of the Roblox Creator Economic Terms, a â€œGroupâ€ exists where Creators have joined together for the purpose of releasing an Experience or other Virtual Content through the Services.â€ exists where Creators have joined together for the purpose of developing an ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. or other Content through the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services.. Groups can upload UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services. for sale in Marketplace and manage Group Payouts.
        2. 

      2. 
CommunityA space for Creators to own and manage for the purpose of connecting with their audience socially as well as showcasing and making updates about their Experience and Virtual content. Users can also create a space where players can connect with others who share similar interests and engage in discussions.. A "CommunityA space for Creators to own and manage for the purpose of connecting with their audience socially as well as showcasing and making updates about their Experience and Virtual content. Users can also create a space where players can connect with others who share similar interests and engage in discussions." exists where Users/Creators have joined together for the purpose to connect with one another. For corporate accounts, the company (or other legal entity) named on the account is considered a CommunityA space for Creators to own and manage for the purpose of connecting with their audience socially as well as showcasing and making updates about their Experience and Virtual content. Users can also create a space where players can connect with others who share similar interests and engage in discussions..

      3. 

    4. 

  4. Roblox Creator Economics.
      

    1. 
RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency..
        

      1. License to RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency.. Creatorâ€™s license to use RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. in connection with the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms..

      2. 

        Earning RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency.. RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. allows Creators to earn RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. (â€œ Earned RobuxRobux generated by a Creator or Developer through the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that they create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services, in compliance with the Roblox Terms and any applicable Additional Terms. Earned Robux only include Robux you have earned in complete compliance with the Roblox Terms of Use, which include the Roblox Community Standards, through the Services from the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that you create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services or Robux awarded by Roblox in designated promotional campaigns. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux earned from: Earnings from your listings in Marketplace or Creator Store, Engagement Based Payouts, In-experience purchases of virtual products, Ad revenue in the Publisher program, and Affiliate sales fees Robux acquired in ways other than monetization of compliant Virtual Content you created (such as Robux obtained from a membership plan or referral bonus, a purchase of Robux or gift card, or trading/selling virtual goods that you did not create) are not considered Earned Robux. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux obtained from: A gift card redemption or direct Robux purchase A monthly Robux grant as part of Premium membership Trading or resale of virtual products Gamepasses sold for template experiences with no legitimate user visits Violative content that was moderated The determination of whether Robux are Earned Robux resides solely in Robloxâ€™s discretion.â€) by selling or monetizing certain UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services. Selling UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services..         4. 

      4. 

        Regional Pricing. Regional Pricing allows Creators to make certain In-Experience ItemsUGC available for acquisition by Users within a given Experience that can only be used within that Experience. In-Experience Items include but are not limited to game passes and special abilities. or Virtual ItemsAny UGC or Roblox created content such as clothing or digital items for use in connection with a Userâ€™s avatar available for acquisition on the Services. more accessible across regions in which users may be located (â€œRegional Pricingâ€). Creators are solely responsible for determining the default price of Virtual ItemsAny UGC or Roblox created content such as clothing or digital items for use in connection with a Userâ€™s avatar available for acquisition on the Services. or In-Experience ItemsUGC available for acquisition by Users within a given Experience that can only be used within that Experience. In-Experience Items include but are not limited to game passes and special abilities. and may decide to have these prices regionalized.
        

        If CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. enables Regional Pricing, the price that CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. originally set for the In-Experience Item or Virtual Item will be adjusted across eligible regions. The regional price for each supported region will be a percentage of the default price with the regional price that CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. determines (â€œRegional Priceâ€). The Regional Price methodology (which may be modified at any point of time) is based on regional economic trends and purchasing power parity. Creators cannot adjust the individual Regional Price directly, but may modify the default price at any time. If a default price is modified, the applicable Regional Price will be updated across all supported regions as applicable. Creators can choose to disable the Regional Pricing, anytime in the Creator Hub.
        

        RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. may suspend or discontinue Regional Pricing for some or all In-Experience ItemsUGC available for acquisition by Users within a given Experience that can only be used within that Experience. In-Experience Items include but are not limited to game passes and special abilities. or Virtual ItemsAny UGC or Roblox created content such as clothing or digital items for use in connection with a Userâ€™s avatar available for acquisition on the Services. for any or all Creators at any time and without liability. RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. provides Regional Pricing "as is" and disclaims all warranties, express or implied, regarding its accuracy, availability, or impact on earnings.
        

        5. 

      5. Random Virtual ItemsAny UGC or Roblox created content such as clothing or digital items for use in connection with a Userâ€™s avatar available for acquisition on the Services.. (either with RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. If a CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. provides the opportunity for a UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. to receive a Random Virtual ItemA Virtual Item available in an Experience that may be acquired â€œrandomlyâ€ by a User., CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services.         By way of example only, if a Creatorâ€™s ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. allows a UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. to acquire a virtual marble that the UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. can then throw into a fountain to receive a Random Virtual ItemA Virtual Item available in an Experience that may be acquired â€œrandomlyâ€ by a User., the CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Developer Exchange Program. This program is governed by the DevEx Terms.â€). While any CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Even then, there is no guarantee of earning money. Subject to certain requirements, policies and limitations that RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. establishes in its sole discretion, Creators participating in the DevEx ProgramStands for â€œDeveloper Exchange Program.â€ An exclusive, by-application-only, program through which Roblox allows approved Creators to exchange Earned Robux for real currency. Earned Robux only include Robux you have earned in complete compliance with the Roblox Terms of Use, which include the Roblox Community Standards, through the Services from the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that you create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services or Robux awarded by Roblox in designated promotional campaigns. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux earned from: Earnings from your listings in Marketplace or Creator Store, Engagement Based Payouts, In-experience purchases of virtual products, Ad revenue in the Publisher program, and Affiliate sales fees Robux acquired in ways other than monetization of compliant Virtual Content you created (such as Robux obtained from a membership plan or referral bonus, a purchase of Robux or gift card, or trading/selling virtual goods that you did not create) are not considered Earned Robux. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux obtained from: A gift card redemption or direct Robux purchase A monthly Robux grant as part of Premium membership Trading or resale of virtual products Gamepasses sold for template experiences with no legitimate user visits Violative content that was moderated The determination of whether Robux are Earned Robux resides solely in Robloxâ€™s discretion. for a payment of real money in an amount determined by RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V., in its sole discretion (the exchange rate and the general requirements, policies, and limitations of the DevEx TermsThe terms of use that govern and outline exchange rate and the general requirements, policies, and limitations of the DevEx Program. Creator Rewards.  â€œCreator Rewardsâ€ is an incentive program that lets you earn RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. (â€œPayout Rewardsâ€) based on certain interactions and purchases on RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V.. If Users take certain actions defined in the Payout Awards Framework (â€œQualifying Actionsâ€), Payout Awards to you are made in accordance with the Payout Awards Framework, may be modified or terminated by RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. at any time, in its sole discretion, and with no obligation to any Creators because of such termination or modification. To be eligible for Creator Rewards, you must be in complete compliance at all times with the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms. of Use, which include the RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. Community Standards. We reserve the right to review, investigate, as well as, suspend you from Creator Rewards in instances where we identify behavior we believe to be abusive or fraudulent, such as: (a) attempts to gain Payout Awards by opening multiple accounts, using different email addresses, using different phone numbers, or using bots; (b) attempts to gain a referral reward by impersonating RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V., another person, or misrepresenting your affiliation with a person or entity; (c) attempts to acquire Users by encouraging existing players to sign up for alternate accounts; (d) having a disproportionately high percentage of chargebacks as determined in Robloxâ€™s sole discretion; or (e) a violation of the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms. and/or the Program Policies.     1.

        3. 

      3. 250 Track Limit. Notwithstanding the foregoing, CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services.       2. 

    2. 
Between Creators and Users or Between Creators.
        

      1. Issues with UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services.. Creators are responsible for handling all issues, including UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services. complaints, relating to their Experiences (including violations of ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users. Rules), Virtual ContentAll UGC and Roblox created content â€“ including all Virtual Items and In-Experience Items â€“ available for acquisition by Users on the Services. Virtual Content has no real world equivalent value and Users do not acquire any enforceable legal rights in and to any Virtual Content based on any transaction on the Services., and other UGCStands for â€œUser Generated Content.â€ UGC is content of any kind or nature, whether material, assets, or otherwise, that Users (including but not limited to Creators) upload to, create and publish on, or otherwise generate through or make available on the Services. Published on the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. in a quick and professional manner.
        2. 

      2. Return of RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency.. If a CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. has acquired Earned RobuxRobux generated by a Creator or Developer through the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that they create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services, in compliance with the Roblox Terms and any applicable Additional Terms. Earned Robux only include Robux you have earned in complete compliance with the Roblox Terms of Use, which include the Roblox Community Standards, through the Services from the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that you create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services or Robux awarded by Roblox in designated promotional campaigns. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux earned from: Earnings from your listings in Marketplace or Creator Store, Engagement Based Payouts, In-experience purchases of virtual products, Ad revenue in the Publisher program, and Affiliate sales fees Robux acquired in ways other than monetization of compliant Virtual Content you created (such as Robux obtained from a membership plan or referral bonus, a purchase of Robux or gift card, or trading/selling virtual goods that you did not create) are not considered Earned Robux. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux obtained from: A gift card redemption or direct Robux purchase A monthly Robux grant as part of Premium membership Trading or resale of virtual products Gamepasses sold for template experiences with no legitimate user visits Violative content that was moderated The determination of whether Robux are Earned Robux resides solely in Robloxâ€™s discretion. in connection with an ExperienceInteractive content Published on the Services by Developers for the engagement and enjoyment of Users., Virtual ContentAll UGC and Roblox created content â€“ including all Virtual Items and In-Experience Items â€“ available for acquisition by Users on the Services.     4. 
California Consumer Privacy Act. CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. shall not knowingly sell any â€œpersonal informationâ€ (as that term is defined by the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018, as amended) belonging to a UserAny person or entity who uses or accesses the Services., and both RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V. and CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. have taken and will continue to take all reasonable measures to protect such personal information under their control or in their possession from unauthorized access by third parties.
      5. 

    12. 

  12. Miscellaneous.
      

    1. 
Content Labels. The ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. display a content maturity label and certain other descriptors about an Experience, as described in the Content Labels, which are incorporated herein by reference. CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. represents and warrants that it will provide accurate, complete, and up-to-date information in any Maturity and Compliance Questionnaire it submits to RobloxThe Roblox Corporation, including its designated subsidiaries: Roblox Prepaid Company LLC, Roblox Godo Kaisha or Roblox Japan, Roblox Canada Inc., Roblox UK Limited (FKA Ceebr Limited), Roblox India Services Private Limited, Roblox Korea Limited, Roblox Australia Pty Ltd, and Roblox Netherlands B.V.. Roblox does not warrant the accuracy of the guidelines or descriptors. CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. acknowledges and agrees that Roblox is not responsible for the accuracy, completeness, validity, or quality of any content maturity labels or descriptors. CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. further acknowledges that it is not entitled to any particular rating. Nothing herein, or in the Content Labels, is intended to control or dictate the content of Creatorâ€™s Experience, for which CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. is solely responsible.
      2. 

    2. 
As Is. The ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. are provided â€œAS ISâ€ and Section 13 of the User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms. is incorporated herein by reference.
      3. 

    3. 
Survival. Any part of these Creator TermsTerms of Use applicable to all Users who access the Services. They cover items such as the use of Roblox Studio, the offering of Experiences and Virtual Content, and the use of music on the Services. which by their nature should survive termination, will survive, including Sections 2b, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, and 12a.

    13. 



Appendix A (China)
    

  1. PURCHASE OF CHINA UGC

Appendix B (Japan)
    

  1. Assignment and Assumption
    Effective as of March 31, 2021 (the â€œEffective Dateâ€), all of the legal status as contracting party, rights, duties, interests, claims, and obligations of Roblox Corporation as an issuer of RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. and as a service provider of the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. It includes websites on the roblox.com domain, our Roblox mobile, virtual reality and Xbox, and PlayStation apps, the Roblox Player, the Roblox Studio, and our other websites, products, software, applications, content, data feeds, and other services. (whether arising prior to or after the Effective Date) in connection with users in Japan are agreed to be transferred and assigned to, and assumed by, Roblox Godo Kaisha (â€œRoblox Japanâ€). By using the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. and as the direct service provider of the ServicesAny service or application offered by Roblox, such as those allowing Users to develop Virtual Content, connect with others, and use Virtual Content created by you and other Users.     3. 

  3. â€œEarnedâ€ Robux and DevEx Program
    If a CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. is allowed to participate in the DevEx ProgramStands for â€œDeveloper Exchange Program.â€ An exclusive, by-application-only, program through which Roblox allows approved Creators to exchange Earned Robux for real currency. This program is governed by the DevEx Terms. and earn Earned RobuxRobux generated by a Creator or Developer through the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that they create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services, in compliance with the Roblox Terms and any applicable Additional Terms. Earned Robux only include Robux you have earned in complete compliance with the Roblox Terms of Use, which include the Roblox Community Standards, through the Services from the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that you create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services or Robux awarded by Roblox in designated promotional campaigns. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux earned from: Earnings from your listings in Marketplace or Creator Store, Engagement Based Payouts, In-experience purchases of virtual products, Ad revenue in the Publisher program, and Affiliate sales fees Robux acquired in ways other than monetization of compliant Virtual Content you created (such as Robux obtained from a membership plan or referral bonus, a purchase of Robux or gift card, or trading/selling virtual goods that you did not create) are not considered Earned Robux. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux obtained from: A gift card redemption or direct Robux purchase A monthly Robux grant as part of Premium membership Trading or resale of virtual products Gamepasses sold for template experiences with no legitimate user visits Violative content that was moderated The determination of whether Robux are Earned Robux resides solely in Robloxâ€™s discretion. under the DevEx ProgramStands for â€œDeveloper Exchange Program.â€ An exclusive, by-application-only, program through which Roblox allows approved Creators to exchange Earned Robux for real currency. This program is governed by the DevEx Terms., then the CreatorAny User who creates, uploads, publishes, generates, or otherwise makes available UGC on the Services. Creators include but are not limited to Developers. may exchange Earned RobuxRobux generated by a Creator or Developer through the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that they create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services, in compliance with the Roblox Terms and any applicable Additional Terms. Earned Robux only include Robux you have earned in complete compliance with the Roblox Terms of Use, which include the Roblox Community Standards, through the Services from the direct sale or other monetization (e.g., EBP) of Virtual Content or other UGC that you create (either alone or with a Community) on the Services or Robux awarded by Roblox in designated promotional campaigns. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux earned from: Earnings from your listings in Marketplace or Creator Store, Engagement Based Payouts, In-experience purchases of virtual products, Ad revenue in the Publisher program, and Affiliate sales fees Robux acquired in ways other than monetization of compliant Virtual Content you created (such as Robux obtained from a membership plan or referral bonus, a purchase of Robux or gift card, or trading/selling virtual goods that you did not create) are not considered Earned Robux. This includes, but is not limited to, Robux obtained from: A gift card redemption or direct Robux purchase A monthly Robux grant as part of Premium membership Trading or resale of virtual products Gamepasses sold for template experiences with no legitimate user visits Violative content that was moderated The determination of whether Robux are Earned Robux resides solely in Robloxâ€™s discretion. for real currency as provided in Section 4c of the Creator TermsTerms of Use applicable to all Users who access the Services.     4. 

  4. Amendments to Section 3c and Section 4 of the User Terms
    Section 3c and Section 4 of the User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms. shall be amended in its entirety as provided in the Exhibit.
    5. 

  5. Amendments to Section 4 of the Creator TermsTerms of Use applicable to all Users who access the Services. They cover items such as the use of Roblox Studio, the offering of Experiences and Virtual Content, and the use of music on the Services.
    Section 4 of the Creator TermsTerms of Use applicable to all Users who access the Services. They cover items such as the use of Roblox Studio, the offering of Experiences and Virtual Content, and the use of music on the Services. shall be amended in its entirety as provided in the Exhibit.
    6. 

  6. Jurisdiction
    If you are an individual (excluding one who accepts the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms. as a business or for business purposes), Section 12b of the User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms. will not apply insofar as it is considered to prejudice your interests unilaterally in violation of Article 10 of the Consumer Contract Act.
    7. 

  7. Limitation of Liability
    If you are an individual (excluding one who accepts the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms. as a business or for business purposes), the phrase â€œto the maximum extent permitted by applicable lawâ€ as provided in Section 13b, 13c and Section 14 of the User TermsTerms applicable to all Users which provide an overview and the associated rules for things like (i) account creation, (ii) using Robux to make purchases, (iii) trading Virtual Items, and (iv) activities prohibited on the Platform. The User Terms also cover some of the more technical legal terms that govern use of the Services, including intellectual property ownership, online safety, disclaimers and other very important legal terms. shall be interpreted to mean â€œunless we are held liable due to our intentional act or gross negligence.â€
    8. 

  8. Pricing and Tax
    When you purchase RobuxThe official currency of Roblox, which can be used to acquire Virtual Content or access to Experiences on the Services. Robux are not a substitute for real currency, do not earn interest, and have no equivalent value in real currency. and Roblox PremiumA renewing subscription that provides Users with certain additional benefits on the Services. Memberships on Roblox.com, Roblox Japan is the merchant of record. The price payable is the price indicated at the time of purchase, and includes applicable Japanese Consumption Tax that Roblox Japan assesses on your purchase, unless otherwise indicated at the time of purchase.
    9. 

  9. Priority
    If there is any inconsistency or conflict between the Roblox TermsThe terms and conditions that apply to and govern a Userâ€™s and Creatorâ€™s use of the Services. The Roblox Terms include the User Terms, Creator Terms, Roblox Community Standards, Roblox Privacy & Cookie Policy, and regional Supplemental Provisions and other Additional Terms. and the supplemental provisions, the supplemental provisions shall prevail.
